meanings.definition: A small backpack used for carrying essentials during a day trip or hike.
meanings.sent1: I always carry my daypack when I go hiking in the mountains.
meanings.sent2: She packed her lunch and water bottle in her daypack for the nature walk.
meanings.sent3: The daypack was so full of snacks, it looked like a mini pantry on my back!
meanings.sent4: Her daypack was a trusty companion, holding all her adventure essentials close.
meanings.sent5: The bright red daypack stood out against the green forest, a beacon of preparedness.

meanings.definition: To pack items for a day trip in a small backpack.
meanings.sent1: I need to daypack some snacks and a map for our hike tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: She daypacks her camera and sunscreen whenever we go to the beach.
meanings.sent3: He daypacks like a pro, fitting everything neatly into his backpack.
meanings.sent4: They daypack their gear efficiently, ready for any spontaneous adventure.
meanings.sent5: Daypacking for the picnic felt like preparing for a mini expedition, exciting and organized.
